text: Cialfo retains Customers' data while they are "customers" and will delete the personal information upon written request.

We also collect information through Customers' devices regarding the operating system, browser type, Internet Protocol (IP) address, URLs of referring/exit pages, device identifiers, and crash data.
We may create anonymized data records from personal information by excluding information that makes the data personally linked to Customers.
We use this anonymous data to power certain Cialfo features, such as scattergrams.
When Customers use our Services, we collect, store and process information and content that Customers post, send, receive, or share.

We may disclose Customers' personal information to professional advisors, such as lawyers, bankers, auditors and insurers, where necessary in the course of the professional services that they render to us.

We may disclose Customers' personal information to professional advisors, such as lawyers, bankers, auditors and insurers, where necessary in the course of the professional services that they render to us.
We collect feedback that Customers provide directly to us through the Services and we collect clickstream data about how Customers interact with and use features in our Services.
We may allow service providers and other third parties to use cookies and other tracking technologies to track Customers' browsing activity over time and across our Services.

Cialfo and our third-party partners, such as our advertising and analytics partners, use cookies and other similar tracking technologies to provide functionality, analyze trends, track users' movements around the website, and to recognize Customers across different devices.

We may allow service providers and other third parties to use cookies and other tracking technologies to track Customers' browsing activity over time and across our Services.

In addition, we also use 'pixel tags', also referred to as clear gifs, web beacons, or web bugs.
Pixel tags also allow us to send email messages and determine whether those email have been opened, to ensure that we are only sending messages that are of interest to our Customers.
We may use this information to reduce or eliminate messages sent to a Customer.
We use Customers' IP address and/or country preference in order to approximate Customers' location to provide Customers with a better experience.
For example, we receive your email address from other Customers when they invite you to join Cialfo.

This Explore Platform Privacy Policy explains how Cialfo collects, uses and shares your and Customers' personal information in connection with your use of the "Explore by CIALFO" Platform and the Services therein (hereinafter, the "Services") as a Customer (as defined in the Terms of Services), and explains your choices for how we handle your and Customers' personal information.
